name: Erdős–Moser equation
summary: The Erdős–Moser equation is the Diophantine equation \(\sum _{i=1}^{m-1}i^{k}=m^{k}\), which states that the sum of the \(k^{th}\) powers of the first \(m-1\) positive integers equals \(m^{k}\). The Erdős–Moser conjecture is that this equation has no solution for positive integers \(k\ge 2\). The only known integer solution is \((k,m)=(1,3)\), which satisfies \(1^{1}+2^{1}=3^{1}\).
